verse: ऐश्वर्यस्य समग्रस्य धर्मस्य यशसश्श्रियः। ज्ञानवैराग्ययोश्चैव षण्णां भग इतीरणा॥ (वि.पु. ६-५-७४)
meaning:
This verse from the Vishnu Purana (6.5.74) describes the six divine attributes or qualities (भग": "bhaga), which summarize and encompass all aspects of divine power and greatness. These attributes are:",
        "1. ऐश्वर्य (aisvarya)": "wealth/affluence",
        "2. समग्र (samagra)": "complete/total",
        "3. धर्म (dharma)": "righteousness/virtue",
        "4. यशस (yashas)": "fame/glory",
        "5. श्रिय (sriya)": "prosperity/abundance",
        "6. ज्ञानवैराग्य (jnanavairagya)": "knowledge/discriminative wisdom and detachment. These six divine attributes are considered to be essential qualities possessed by the deity/Supreme Being, and they represent the ultimate state of perfection and greatness.
